oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Apauly-Tustennuggee
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Head and shoulders portrait of Apauly-Tustennuggee. He wears a striped jacket, red collar, silver necklace, patterned belt and silver headband, face paint and feathered headdress.

Apauly-Tustennuggee was part of the Creek delegation challenging the 1825 Treaty of Indian Springs, which demanded cession of all Creek lands in Georgia in exchange for cash. McKenney's brief description of him was "a chief and a warrior… a firm, brave man- and of good sense."
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: McKenney, Thomas L. (Thomas Loraine), 1785-1859; Hall, James, 1793-1868
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:publisher: Daniel Rice and James G. Clark
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Creek Indians; Indians of North America-- Biography; Indians of North America-- Portraits; Indians of North America-- History
Indigenous peoples; Headdresses;
